title: Year 10 Mathematics
subtitle: AOS 7: Trigonometry - Mock CAT
instructions: Answer ALL questions in the spaces provided
Show all working to receive full marks
CAS calculators are permitted unless otherwise stated
Diagrams are NOT drawn to scale
Give answers to 2 decimal places unless otherwise specified
Exact values should be given where indicated

questions.text:
In a right-angled triangle, if the opposite side is 5 cm and the hypotenuse is 13 cm, what is sin(θ)?

A. 5/12
B. 5/13
C. 12/13
D. 13/5

What is the exact value of tan(45°)?

A. 0
B. 1/2
C. 1
D. √3

A ladder leans against a wall making a 65° angle with the ground. If the ladder is 4 m long, how far is the base from the wall?

A. 4 × sin(65°)
B. 4 × cos(65°)
C. 4 × tan(65°)
D. 4 ÷ cos(65°)

An angle of elevation of 35° is observed from ground level. This means:

A. The observer is looking down at 35° below horizontal
B. The observer is looking up at 35° above horizontal
C. The object is 35 m above the ground
D. The angle between two objects is 35°

A bearing of 135° means the direction is:

A. North-East
B. South-East
C. South-West
D. North-West

The sine rule states that in any triangle ABC:

A. a² = b² + c² - 2bc·cos(A)
B. a/sin(A) = b/sin(B) = c/sin(C)
C. Area = ½ab·sin(C)
D. sin²(A) + cos²(A) = 1

Convert 60° to radians:

A. π/6
B. π/4
C. π/3
D. π/2

On the unit circle, at angle θ = 180°, the coordinates are:

A. (1, 0)
B. (0, 1)
C. (-1, 0)
D. (0, -1)

The exact value of cos(30°) is:

A. 1/2
B. √2/2
C. √3/2
D. 1

The period of y = sin(x) is:

A. π
B. 2π
C. 180°
D. 90°

parts.label: b

parts.label: a

parts.label: b

questions.text:
Applications in Three Dimensions

A rectangular room has length 6 m, width 4 m, and height 3 m. A spider is at corner A on the floor, and a fly is at the opposite corner B on the ceiling.

parts.label: a
parts.text: Draw a diagram of the room showing corners A and B.

parts.label: b
parts.text: Find the length of the diagonal across the floor from A.

parts.label: c
parts.text: Find the direct distance from A to B through the air.
